lead_paragraph: Tiger Woods failed to win a 72-hole tournament for the first time since July 9, finishing two shots behind Yang Yong-eun of South Korea at the HSBC Champions tournament yesterday in Shanghai. Yang, a regular on the Japanese tour who has played infrequently outside Asia, closed with a three-under 69 for a 14-under 274 total. The loss ended Woods’s streak of stroke-play victories, dating to his runner-up finish in the Western Open. The only streak that remains for Woods is his six straight victories on the PGA Tour. The HSBC Champions is sanctioned by the Asian, Australasian, South African and European tours, and it was the first official tournament of Europe’s 2007 season.
